doc:data.doc:title: Open Source Projects
doc:data.doc:body:
{$title}
The motivation to write open-source software comes from 3 main reasons:
I am dissatisfied with the available solutions in some way and want to do it differently,
I am lazy and want to make my work more comfortable and easier,
While preparing an IT course, I come across an interesting idea, or a participant suggests one.
I use some of my code daily, others less often, depending on what I am currently working on.
Apart from archived projects, I try to improve them gradually.
MvcCore
A PHP framework for building web applications that powers my systems or serves educational purposes in OOP. So far, my largest project.
Focus on performance
As few magical functions as possible.
The fastest learning curve possible.
Focus on structure
The core framework can be used for simple applications.
For complex projects, a wide range of extensions is available that work together - routers, datagrids, etc.
You will never have cluttered folders with controllers, templates, widgets, etc. again; all MVC components can be structured as needed.
Extremely large applications can be structured independently into Composer packages and used together as modules of one main application.
Focus on freedom
The framework does not enforce any universal solution or style; the developer has maximum creative freedom.
The framework emphasizes long backward compatibility.
The framework can create applications or pack extensive libraries into a single PHP file (without PHAR packaging),
making them even faster thanks to simplified opcache.
The framework includes a documentation repository and many example repositories.
Desharp
A .NET utility for dumping or logging variables, objects, exceptions with call tracing, and many other features.
The output can be displayed in the development output window or CLI.
The output can also be shown as a floating window in the HTML response of an ASP.NET application (similar to PHP tracy).
The output can be logged by priority to HDD as clickable HTML output or plain text.
Configuration - logging settings by levels, email notifications, debug IP addresses, custom debug panels, etc.
The project includes example repositories, Visual Studio code snippets, and more.
Only usable in .NET Framework (reimplementation for .NET Core still pending).
Ext.TS
A project for web application development with the Ext.JS framework in TypeScript. Generating a map of TS types from JSDocs and usage examples.
The project includes a type definition generator for Ext.JS written in C#, extracting an AST tree of types from the Ext.JS toolkit ZIP file.
Pre-generated type definitions for individual Ext.JS versions are available as separate repositories.
The generated type definitions include full JSDocs documentation for the framework, with working links, formatted code, etc.
Pre-generated or custom-generated, more concise type definitions can be used.
TypeScript definitions for Ext.JS sometimes provide better guidance than Sencha's paid development environment.
The project includes example repositories for various framework versions.
Databasic.NET
A .NET database layer to simplify working with relational databases in SQL. It does not aim to be an ORM like EntityFramework and does not use LINQ.
Implementations for Microsoft SQL Server/MySQL/MariaDB/PostgreSQL/Oracle/ODBC/OLEDB using a chosen extension.
Serialization of database data into scalar types, typed classes, ActiveRecord classes, collections, or others using annotations.
Change detection in ActiveRecord classes, insertion, updating, and deletion based on changes and annotations.
Option to choose between multiple connections using annotation or directly as another query parameter.
Only usable in .NET Framework (reimplementation for .NET Core still pending).
Web Dev Server for Node.JS
A simple HTTP server for developing smaller applications or for training purposes.
Simple development – TypeScript definitions, hot reload of the application upon changes (no need to restart the server and debugger).
Few dependencies – only tslib and mime-db. If necessary, express and others can be used.
Main features – default script of the application/folders, file transfers, session handling, error resolution, logging, error pages, etc.
The project includes example repositories.
Notepad++ JS/HTML Formatter Plugin
A plugin for "jN Plugin," this is a reimplementation of a code deobfuscator from the domain jsbeautifier.org.
Ajax.JS
A utility offering the same functions and additional features that built-in objects window.XMLHttpRequest and window.fetch() still lack to this day.
Pooler
A library for parallel tasks in the .NET framework to reduce excessive system load caused by background tasks.
SReality RSS
A configurable RSS feed for the largest Czech real estate portal, utilizing its API, including images and Google Maps. Very useful if you are quickly looking for a new apartment.
IMDB Training Database
A portion of the IMDB (International Movie Database) for the purpose of training database optimization and queries.
{hr()}
Archived Projects
jDiet.JS
A small JS framework from the jQuery era for JS nerds, created out of disillusionment with bloated jQuery.
Its syntax is fully compatible with jQuery, but the framework contains only functions that were actually used, all in just 8 kB (GZIP).
ClassAdvanced.JS
A universal library for writing classes during the widespread era of ECMAScript 5, when there were no constructs for class writing.
Supported constructs - constructor, extensions for static and dynamic members, parent function calls, namespaces.
Similar behavior to Late Static Binding in PHP for this.self and this.static.
Supported environments - browsers (MSIE6+, Firefox, Webkit, Opera), Node.JS, WSH (Windows Script Host), Adobe ExtendScript Toolkit.
Inheritance checks using the instanceof construct and minimal self-reflection for classes and namespaces.
Syntax configuration for class writing.
Support for "Go To Definition (F12)" in Visual Studio IDE and other editors with a full-featured JS interpreter.
Very fast, efficient, super small - 2.8 kB (GZIP).
Inspired by PHP OOP, Ext.JS, and Prototype.JS syntax.
GradientOverlay.JS
A library for creating color overlays on images in the browser from a time when the CSS property filter was not widely adopted.
